newsitem.title: BELGIUM: BELGIAN AMONG RELEASED HOSTAGES IN PERU.
newsitem.headline: BELGIAN AMONG RELEASED HOSTAGES IN PERU.

text.p: A Belgian national representing the Food and Agriculture Organisation (FAO) is among 225 hostages released from the Japanese ambassador's residence in Lima, Peru, the Foreign Ministry in Brussels said on Monday.
A spokesman said the man was Jean-Francois Ghyoot, who works for the Rome-based United Nations body.
He had no details about Ghyoot's physical condition after six nights in the hands of leftist rebels who are seeking the release of 400 to 500 jailed comrades.

The spokesman said Ghyoot's family had been informed of his release late on Sunday night along with 224 others by the Tupac Amaru Revolutionary Movement (MRTA). It was now up to the FAO to decide whether Ghyoot would stay in Lima or be recalled.
The guerillas are still holding 140 people including businessmen and Peruvian government officials.
